title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.DeviceDefinition.version` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `DeviceDefinition.version` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `DeviceDefinition.version` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `DeviceDefinition.version` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `DeviceDefinition.version` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4B: `DeviceDefinition.version` 0..* `string` * R4: `DeviceDefinition.version` 0..* `string`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `DeviceDefinition.version` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `DeviceDefinition.version`.

short.value: The version of the device or software

definition.value: The version of the device or software.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: Unique id for inter-element referencing

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: The type of the device version, e.g. manufacturer, approved, internal

definition.value: The type of the device version, e.g. manufacturer, approved, internal.

requirements.value: Element `DeviceDefinition.version.type` is mapped to FHIR R4 structure `DeviceDefinition`, but has no target element specified.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

short.value: Additional content defined by implementations

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

short.value: The type of the device version, e.g. manufacturer, approved, internal

definition.value: The type of the device version, e.g. manufacturer, approved, internal.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: The hardware or software module of the device to which the version applies

definition.value: The hardware or software module of the device to which the version applies.

comment.value: Note that the module of the device would not need to be tracked as a separate device, e.g., using different UDI, thus would typically involve one or more software modules. For example, a device may involve two software modules each on a different version.

requirements.value: Element `DeviceDefinition.version.component` is mapped to FHIR R4 structure `DeviceDefinition`, but has no target element specified.
